translation: Thus I have heard. One time, when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa in Rājagaha, accompanied by one thousand two hundred and fifty bhikṣus:

source_sentence: 是時，摩竭王阿闍世欲伐跋祇，王自念言：「彼雖勇健，人眾豪強，以我取彼，
translation: At that time the king of Magadha, Ajātaśatru, wishing to conquer Vṛji, thought to himself, “Although he is brave and strong, his people are numerous and powerful.

source_sentence: 未足為難。」

translation: The king Ajātaśatru then summoned the brahman minister Varṣa and told him, “Go to Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa and pay your respects to the World-honored One.

source_sentence: 持我名字，禮世尊足，問訊世尊：『起居輕利，遊步強耶？』
translation: Take my name, bow at the feet of the Bhagavān, and greet the Bhagavān, saying, 'Is it easy to get up and stay, or is it hard to walk?'

source_sentence: 又白世尊：『跋祇國人自恃勇健，民眾豪強，不順伏我，我欲伐之，不審世尊何所誡勅？』
translation: Again, he said to the Bhagavān, 'The people of Vṛji rely on their own courage and strength, and the people are so powerful that they won't obey me; I want to conquer them, but I don't know what the Bhagavān admonishes.'

source_sentence: 若有教誡，汝善憶念，勿有遺漏，如所聞說。
translation: If you are instructed, remember it well and don't leave anything behind, as you've heard it taught.

source_sentence: 如來所言，終不虛妄。」
translation: Whatever the Tathāgata says, it's never false.

source_sentence: 大臣禹舍受王教已，即乘寶車詣耆闍崛山，到所止處，下車步進，至世尊所，
translation: Having received the king’s instruction, the treasury councilor went to Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa in a richly decorated chariot and reached the place where the World-honored One was staying.

source_sentence: 問訊畢，一面坐，白世尊曰：「摩竭王阿闍世[旃-方+示]首佛足，
translation: Having saluted him, he sat to one side and said to the World-honored One:

source_sentence: 敬問慇懃：『起居輕利，遊步強耶？』
translation: He respectfully asked the monk, 'Is it easy to get up and stay, or is walking strong?'

source_sentence: 又白世尊：『跋祇國人自恃勇健，民眾豪強，不順伏我，我欲伐之，不審世尊何所誡勅？』」
translation: Again, he said to the Bhagavān, 'The people of Vṛji rely on their own courage and strength, and the people are so powerful that they won't obey me; I want to conquer them, but I don't know what the Bhagavān admonishes.'

translation: At that time Ānanda was standing behind the World-honored One, fanning him. The Buddha said to Ānanda:

source_sentence: 講議正事不？」
translation: Is the right thing to discuss?

source_sentence: 答曰：「聞之。」
translation: He replied, I've heard it.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「若能爾者，長幼和順，轉更增盛，其國久安，無能侵損。
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda: If you can do so, the people of Jambudvīpa will be harmonious with each other and grow in prosperity. For a long time their country will be peaceful and no one will attack or harm it.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝聞跋祇國人君臣和順，上下相敬不？」
translation: Have you heard that the people of Vṛji and their officials are harmonious and respectful to each other?

source_sentence: 答曰：「聞之。」
translation: He replied, I've heard it.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若能爾者，長幼和順，轉更增盛，其國久安，無能侵損。
translation: If they can do so, the people will be harmonious from generation to generation and grow in prosperity. The country will be peaceful for a long time and no one will be able to harm it.

source_sentence: 阿難！

source_sentence: 汝聞跋祇國人奉法曉忌，不違禮度不？」

source_sentence: 答曰：「聞之。」

source_sentence: 阿難！

source_sentence: 汝聞跋祇國人孝事父母，敬順師長不？」
translation: Do you hear that the people of Vṛji serve their parents and respect their teachers and elders?

source_sentence: 答曰：「聞之。」
translation: He replied, I've heard it.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若能爾者，長幼和順，轉更增上，其國久安，無能侵損。
translation: If they can do so, the people will be harmonious from generation to generation and grow even stronger. The country will be peaceful for a long time and no one will be able to attack or harm it.

source_sentence: 汝聞跋祇國人恭於宗廟，致敬鬼神不？」
translation: Have you heard that the people of Vṛji respect their sect's temple and venerate ghosts and spirits?

source_sentence: 答曰：「聞之。」
translation: He replied, I've heard it.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若能爾者，長幼和順，轉更增上，其國久安，無能侵損。

source_sentence: 阿難！

source_sentence: 汝聞跋祇國人閨門真正潔淨無穢，至於戲笑，言不及邪不？」
translation: Do you hear that the houses of the Vṛji countrymen are truly pure and undefiled, and when they play and laugh, do you say it's not as good as wrong?

source_sentence: 答曰：「聞之。」
translation: He replied, I've heard it.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若能爾者，長幼和順，轉更增盛，其國久安，無能侵損。

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝聞跋祇國人宗事沙門，敬持戒者，瞻視護養，未甞懈惓不？」
translation: Have you heard that the people of Vṛji serve as monks and respectfully observe precepts, looking after and protecting them without laziness?

source_sentence: 答曰：「聞之。」
translation: He replied, I've heard it.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若能爾者，長幼和順，轉更增盛，其國久安，無能侵損。」
translation: If someone can do so, the young and old will be harmonious and grow in prosperity, and their country will be peaceful for a long time without being able to harm them.

source_sentence: 時，大臣禹舍白佛言：「彼國人民，若行一法，猶不可圖，況復具七？
translation: Minister Varṣa then said to the Buddha, If the people of that country practice one thing, they still won't be able to do it, so why wouldn't they practice seven?

source_sentence: 國事多故，今請辭還歸。」
translation: Because there are so many national affairs, I'm now inviting you to leave and return.

source_sentence: 佛言：「可，宜知是時。」
translation: The Buddha said, Yes, it's a good idea to know this.

source_sentence: 時，禹舍即從座起，遶佛三匝，揖讓而退。
translation: Upāsaka then rose from his seat, circumambulated the Buddha three times, bowed his head in respect, and withdrew.

source_sentence: 其去未久，佛告阿難：「汝勅羅閱祇左右諸比丘盡集講堂。」
translation: Not long after his departure, the Buddha told Ānanda, You've ordered all the monks around Rājagṛha to assemble in the lecture hall.

source_sentence: 對曰：「唯然。」
translation: He replied, Yes.

source_sentence: 即詣羅閱祇城，集諸比丘，盡會講堂，白世尊曰：「諸比丘已集，唯聖知時。」
translation: He went to Rājagṛha, gathered the monks, assembled them all in the assembly hall, and said to the Bhagavān, The monks have assembled; only the noble one knows when.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即從座起，詣法講堂，就座而坐，告諸比丘：「我當為汝說七不退法，
translation: At that time, the World-honored One rose from his seat. Having arrived at the Dharma assembly hall, he took his seat in the prepared position and said to the bhikṣus: I shall teach you seven principles of nonbacksliding.

source_sentence: 諦聽！
translation: Listen attentively!

source_sentence: 諦聽！
translation: Listen attentively!

source_sentence: 善思念之。」
translation: Think of it well.

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘白佛言：「唯然，世尊！
translation: The monks then said to the Buddha, Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願樂欲聞！」
translation: May it please you to hear!

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「七不退法者：一曰數相集會，講論正義，則長幼和順，
translation: The Buddha said to the bhikṣus: The seven principles of non-backsliding are as follows:

source_sentence: 法不可壞。
translation: The Dharma is indestructible.

source_sentence: 二曰上下和同，敬順無違，則長幼和順，法不可壞。
translation: The second is that when the superior and inferior are harmonious and there is no disobedience in terms of respect and obedience, both the young and old are harmonious and the Dharma cannot be broken.

source_sentence: 三曰奉法曉忌，不違制度，則長幼和順，法不可壞。
translation: The third is the principle of following the Dharma and knowing one’s fears without disobeying the disciplinary rules, so that all living beings, young and old, may be harmonious and the Dharma should not perish.

source_sentence: 四曰若有比丘力能護眾，多諸知識，宜敬事之，則長幼和順，法不可壞。
translation: Fourth, if a bhikṣu is capable of protecting the sangha through his supernatural power and possesses extensive knowledge, it is advisable for him to be treated with reverence. The bhikṣus should be harmonious toward all living beings, whether old or young, so that the dharma will not perish.

source_sentence: 五曰念護心意，孝敬為首，則長幼和順，法不可壞。
translation: The fifth is the principle of being mindful and guarding one’s thoughts with filial piety as the foremost, so that all living beings, young and old, may be harmonious and the Dharma should not perish.

source_sentence: 六曰淨修梵行，不隨欲態，則長幼和順，法不可壞。
translation: The sixth is the practice of pure and genuine austerity. If one does not follow the state of desire, there will be harmonious rebirths for both old and young. The Dharma will not perish.

source_sentence: 七曰先人後己，不貪名利，則長幼和順，法不可壞。」
translation: Seventh, if a former person doesn't crave fame and profit after themselves, then the old and young will be harmonious and the Dharma won't break down.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「復有七法，令法增長，無有損耗。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, Again, there are seven things that will cause the Dharma to grow and not be damaged.

source_sentence: 一者樂於少事，不好多為，則法增長，無有損耗。
translation: The first is that if one delights in few things and doesn’t enjoy doing many things, then the Dharma will grow without loss or gain.

source_sentence: 二者樂於靜默，不好多言。
translation: The second is to take delight in quietude and not talk loudly.

source_sentence: 三者少於睡眠，無有昏昧。
translation: Third, they are free from drowsiness and do not indulge in sleep.

source_sentence: 四者不為群黨，言無益事。
translation: Fourth, he should not speak in ways that are unbeneficial to any group of followers.

source_sentence: 五者不以無德而自稱譽。
translation: Five, they don't praise themselves for their lack of virtue.

source_sentence: 六者不與惡人而為伴黨。
translation: The sixth is not to associate with evil people.

source_sentence: 七者樂於山林閑靜獨處。
translation: The seventh is to take delight in a quiet and secluded place in a forested retreat.

source_sentence: 如是比丘！
translation: So it is, monks!

source_sentence: 則法增長，無有損耗。」
translation: Then the Dharma will grow, and there won't be any loss or gain.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「復有七法，令法增長，無有損耗。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, Again, there are seven things that will cause the Dharma to grow and not be damaged.

source_sentence: 何謂為七？
translation: What are these seven?

source_sentence: 一者有信，信於如來、至真、正覺，十號具足。
translation: First, they have faith in the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One. They are endowed with ten epithets:

source_sentence: 二者知慚，恥於己闕。
translation: The second is to know shame and be ashamed of one’s own faults.

source_sentence: 三者知愧，羞為惡行。
translation: The third is knowledge of shame, which is bad conduct.

source_sentence: 四者多聞，其所受持，上中下善，義味深奧，清淨無穢，梵行具足。
translation: The fourth is learned and well-versed. He retains the teachings, which are good in the upper, middle, and lower levels; they have profound meanings and flavors, are pure and spotless, and are endowed with the practice of austerity.

source_sentence: 五者精勤苦行，滅惡修善，勤習不捨。
translation: (5) They should exert themselves with ascetic practices to eradicate evil and cultivate goodness. They should exert themselves diligently without giving up.

source_sentence: 六者昔所學習，憶念不忘。
translation: The sixth is to remember whatever one has learned and practiced in the past without forgetting it.

source_sentence: 七者修習智慧，知生滅法，趣賢聖要，盡諸苦本。
translation: The seventh is to cultivate wisdom in order to know the law of arising and ceasing. He should follow the ways of the wise and holy, extinguishing the roots of suffering.

source_sentence: 如是七法，則法增長，無有損耗。」
translation: Thus, these seven things cause the Dharma to grow and there's no loss or gain.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「復有七法，令法增長，無有損耗。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, Again, there are seven things that will cause the Dharma to grow and not be damaged.

source_sentence: 何謂為七？
translation: What are these seven?

source_sentence: 一者敬佛，二者敬法，三者敬僧，四者敬戒，五者敬定，六者敬順父母，
translation: They are (1) honoring the Buddha, (2) honoring the Dharma, (3) honoring the Sangha, (4) honoring the precepts, (5) honoring concentration, and (6) following one’s parents.

source_sentence: 七者敬不放逸。
translation: The seventh is to be respectful and not careless.

source_sentence: 如是七法，則法增長，無有損耗。」
translation: Thus, these seven things cause the Dharma to grow and there's no loss or gain.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「復有七法，則法增長，無有損耗。
translation: The Buddha said to the bhikṣus: Again, there is another set of seven principles that enables the Dharma to flourish and protect it.

source_sentence: 何謂為七法？
translation: What are the seven dharmas?

source_sentence: 一者觀身不淨，二者觀食不淨，三者不樂世間，四者常念死想，五者起無常想，
translation: One, observing body as impure; two, observing food as impure; three, not delighting in the world; four, always thinking of death; and five, giving rise to thoughts of impermanence.

source_sentence: 六者無常苦想，七者苦無我想。
translation: The sixth is perception of impermanence as suffering, and the seventh is perception of suffering as selflessness.

source_sentence: 如是七法，則法增長，無有損耗。」
translation: Thus, these seven things cause the Dharma to grow and there's no loss or gain.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「復有七法，則法增長，無有損耗。
translation: The Buddha said to the bhikṣus: Again, there is another set of seven principles that enables the Dharma to flourish and protect it.

source_sentence: 何謂為七？
translation: What are these seven?

source_sentence: 一者修念覺意，閑靜無欲，出要無為。
translation: The first is to cultivate mindfulness, awakening thought, quiescence, and the absence of desire, transcending essentials and doing nothing.

source_sentence: 二者修法覺意。
translation: The second is the mind that cultivates the awakening to the Dharma.

source_sentence: 三者修精進覺意。
translation: Third, he cultivates the mind of enlightenment with effort.

source_sentence: 四者修喜覺意。
translation: Fourth, he cultivates the mind of joyful awakening.

source_sentence: 五者修猗覺意。
translation: The fifth is to cultivate the mind of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 六者修定覺意。
translation: Sixth, he cultivates the mind of enlightenment in concentration.

source_sentence: 七者修護覺意。
translation: The seventh is to cultivate the mind of guarding awakening.

source_sentence: 如是七法，則法增長，無有損耗。」
translation: Thus, these seven things cause the Dharma to grow and there's no loss or gain.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「有六不退法，令法增長，無有損耗。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, There are six kinds of nonretrogression that cause the Dharma to grow and not be damaged.

source_sentence: 何謂為六？
translation: What are these six?

source_sentence: 一者身常行慈，不害眾生。
translation: One, they always practice compassion with their bodies and don't harm sentient beings.

source_sentence: 二者口宣仁慈，不演惡言。
translation: The second is to verbally proclaim kindness and not speak harsh words.

source_sentence: 三者意念慈心，不懷壞損。
translation: The third is to be mindful and compassionate, not harboring harm.

source_sentence: 四者得淨利養，與眾共之，平等無二。
translation: Fourth, they attain pure benefits and share them with others equally and without distinction.

source_sentence: 五者持賢聖戒，無有闕漏，亦無垢穢，必定不動。
translation: The fifth is to keep the precepts of the wise and holy, without any deficiency or impurity, always unmoving.

source_sentence: 六者見賢聖道，以盡苦際。
translation: The sixth is seeing the path of the wise and holy, which leads to the end of suffering.

source_sentence: 如是六法，則法增長，無有損耗。」
translation: Such are the six dharmas that make a dharma grow and have no loss or gain.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「復有六不退法，令法增長，無有損耗。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, Again, there are six principles of nonretrogression that cause the Dharma to grow and not be damaged.

source_sentence: 一者念佛，二者念法，三者念僧，四者念戒，五者念施，六者念天。
translation: One is mindfulness of the Buddha, two are mindfulness of the Dharma, three are mindfulness of the Sangha, four are mindfulness of precepts, five are mindfulness of generosity, and six are mindfulness of the gods.

source_sentence: 修此六念，則法增長，無有損耗。」
translation: When you cultivate these six kinds of mindfulness, the Dharma grows and there's no loss or gain.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於羅閱祇隨宜住已，告阿難言：「汝等皆嚴，吾欲詣竹園。」
translation: After the Bhagavān had stayed in Rājagṛha as appropriate, he told Ānanda, All of you are so strict that I want to go to the bamboo grove.

source_sentence: 對曰：「唯然。」
translation: He replied, Yes.

source_sentence: 即嚴衣鉢，與諸大眾侍從世尊，路由摩竭，次到竹園，往堂上坐，與諸比丘說戒、定、慧。
translation: He then arranged his robes, bowls, and all the other members of the assembly to attend the World-honored One. Traveling on the highway of Magadha, he next reached the Bamboo Grove and sat down in the hall. He taught the monks the precepts, concentration, and wisdom.

source_sentence: 修戒獲定，得大果報；
translation: Cultivating precepts and attaining absorption brings great reward.

source_sentence: 修定獲智，得大果報；
translation: By cultivating concentration one gains knowledge and attains great reward as a result.

source_sentence: 修智心淨，得等解脫，盡於三漏——欲漏、有漏、無明漏。
translation: When the mind that cultivates wisdom is purified, he attains equal liberation and ends the three contaminants - the contaminants of desire, the contaminants of existence, and the contaminants of ignorance.

source_sentence: 已得解脫生解脫智：生死已盡，梵行已立，所作已辦，不受後有。
translation: Having attained liberation, knowledge of liberation arises: birth and death have ended, the religious practice has been established, what was to be done has been done, and there's no later existence.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於竹園隨宜住已，告阿難曰：「汝等皆嚴，當詣巴陵弗城。」
translation: After the Bhagavān had stayed in the bamboo grove as appropriate, he told Ānanda, All of you, be solemn and go to the city of Pariputra.

source_sentence: 對曰：「唯然。」
translation: He replied, Yes.

source_sentence: 即嚴衣鉢，與諸大眾侍從世尊，路由摩竭，次到巴陵弗城，巴陵樹下坐。
translation: He then arranged his robes, bowls, and all the other members of the assembly to attend the World-honored One. On the highway through Magadha he next reached the city of Pariputra and took his seat at the foot of a paṭala tree.

source_sentence: 時，諸清信士聞佛與諸大眾遠來至此巴陵樹下，即共出城，遙見世尊在巴陵樹下，
translation: When the lay devotees heard that the Buddha and the assembly of bhikṣus had come from a distant land at the foot of a paṭala tree, they came out of the city together. They saw the World-honored One standing at the foot of the paṭala tree from afar.

source_sentence: 容貌端正，諸根寂定，善調第一。
translation: His appearance was handsome and his sense faculties were tranquil and concentrated. He was the foremost in being well trained.

source_sentence: 譬猶大龍，以水清澄，無有塵垢；
translation: It is as if a great dragon were to purify the water without dust and dirt.

source_sentence: 三十二相、八十種好，莊嚴其身。
translation: His body was adorned with the thirty-two marks and eighty kinds of beauty.

source_sentence: 見已歡喜，漸到佛所，頭面禮足，却坐一面。
translation: Rejoicing at that sight, he gradually approached the Buddha. After honoring him by bowing his forehead and feet, he withdrew and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊漸為說法，示教利喜，諸清信士聞佛說法，即白佛言：「我欲歸依佛、法、聖眾，
translation: At that time, the World-honored One gradually taught the Dharma to them, encouraging, benefiting, and delighting them. Having heard the Buddha teach the Dharma, the lay devotees said to the Buddha: I wish to take refuge in the buddhas, the Dharma, and the holy ones.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊哀愍，聽許為優婆塞，自今已後，不殺、不盜、不婬、不欺、不飲酒，
translation: May the World-honored One take pity on us and allow us to become laymen. From now on we abstain from killing, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, speaking falsehoods, and ingesting intoxicants.

source_sentence: 奉戒不忘。
translation: He observes the precepts and doesn't forget them.

source_sentence: 明欲設供，唯願世尊與諸大眾垂愍屈顧。」
translation: It's clear that they want to make offerings, so may the Bhagavān and the masses have pity on them.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊默然許可。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān quietly agreed.

source_sentence: 諸清信士見佛默然，即從座起，遶佛三匝，作禮而歸。
translation: The lay devotees, seeing that the Buddha remained silent, rose from their seats, circumambulated him three times, made obeisance, and withdrew.

source_sentence: 尋為如來起大堂舍，平治處所，掃灑燒香，嚴敷寶座。
translation: He then built a large hall for the Tathāgata, leveled his place, swept and burned incense, and adorned it with a jeweled throne.

source_sentence: 供設既辦，往白世尊：「所設已具，唯聖知時。」
translation: When the offerings had been prepared, he went to the Bhagavān and said, The offerings have been prepared, but only the noble one knows when.

source_sentence: 於是，世尊即從座起，著衣持鉢，與大眾俱詣彼講堂，澡手洗足，處中而坐。
translation: Thereupon, the World-honored One rose from his seat, put on his outer robes, took his almsbowl, and, accompanied by the assembly of bhikṣus, entered the assembly hall. He bathed his hands and feet, washed his feet, and remained seated there.

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘在左面坐，諸清信士在右面坐。
translation: The monks then sat on the left side, and the pure believers sat on the right side.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸清信士曰：「凡人犯戒，有五衰耗。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān addressed the pure believers, saying, There are five kinds of decay among ordinary people who violate the precepts.

source_sentence: 何謂為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者求財，所願不遂。
translation: One, they seek wealth but their wishes are not fulfilled.

source_sentence: 二者設有所得，日當衰耗。
translation: Second, if there is something to be gained, it will surely perish in the future.

source_sentence: 三者在所至處，眾所不敬。
translation: Third, wherever a bhikṣu resides he is not respected by the sangha.

source_sentence: 四者醜名惡聲，流聞天下。
translation: The fourth is an ugly name and a bad sound that spreads throughout the world.

source_sentence: 五者身壞命終，當入地獄。」
translation: Five, when his body breaks up and his life ends, he'll go to hell.

source_sentence: 又告諸清信士：「凡人持戒，有五功德。
translation: Again, he told the pure believers, There are five virtues of ordinary people who observe precepts.

source_sentence: 何謂為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者諸有所求，輙得如願。
translation: One, whatever they seek, they'll attain it just as they wish.

source_sentence: 二者所有財產，增益無損。
translation: The second is the possession of property, which increases and doesn't decrease.

source_sentence: 三者所往之處，眾人敬愛。
translation: The third is that the places where they go are respected and loved by everyone.

source_sentence: 四者好名善譽，周聞天下。
translation: Fourth, he was renowned and praised everywhere in the world.

source_sentence: 五者身壞命終，必生天上。」
translation: Five, when his body breaks up and his life ends, he'll surely be born in heaven.

source_sentence: 時，夜已半，告諸信士，宜各還歸。
translation: At midnight he said to the faithful monks, “Let us return home.

source_sentence: 諸清信士即承佛教，遶佛三匝，禮足而歸。
translation: The pure believers then accepted the teaching, circumambulated the Buddha three times, bowed their heads at his feet, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於後夜明相出時，至閑靜處，天眼清徹，見諸大天神各封宅地，
translation: At that time the World-honored One came out in the late watch of the night at dawn and went to a secluded place. His divine eye was clear and penetrating, and he saw all the great heavenly gods each occupying their respective residences.

source_sentence: 中神、下神亦封宅地。
translation: The middle and lower deities also sealed the residences.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊即還講堂，就座而坐，世尊知時故問阿難：「誰造此巴陵弗城？」
translation: The Bhagavān then returned to the lecture hall, took his seat, and sat down. Knowing the time, the Bhagavān asked Ānanda, Who built this palanquin city?

source_sentence: 阿難白佛：「此是禹舍大臣所造，以防禦跋祇。」
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, This was built by Minister Upāsaka to defend Vṛji.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「造此城者，正得天意，吾於後夜明相出時，至閑靜處，以天眼見諸大神天各封宅地，
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda: Those who built this city had obtained the wishes of heavenly gods. On the latter watch of the night, at dawn, I went to a secluded place and, through my supernormal vision, saw all the great deities and goddesses occupying the earth as their residences.

source_sentence: 中、下諸神亦封宅地。
translation: The gods in the middle and lower heavens also seal their residences.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 當知諸大神天所封宅地，有人居者，安樂熾盛。
translation: You should know that the residences of the great deities and goddesses are enclosed by people who live in them, and their well-being flourishes.

source_sentence: 中神所封，中人所居；
translation: They are ruled by the gods of the middle and inhabited by the people of the middle.

source_sentence: 下神所封，下人所居。
translation: They are enshrined by the inferior deities and inhabited by the inferior people.

source_sentence: 功德多少，各隨所止。
translation: The number of merits varies according to where they are located.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 此處賢人所居，商賈所集，國法真實，無有欺罔，此城最勝，諸方所推，
translation: This is the place where the wise people live and where merchants and traders are collected. The national law is true and there is nothing to deceive. This city is the most superior among all the cities, which are esteemed by various quarters.

source_sentence: 不可破壞。
translation: They can't be destroyed.

source_sentence: 此城久後若欲壞時，必以三事：一者大水，二者大火，三者中人與外人謀，
translation: When the city is about to disintegrate after a long time, it must be destroyed because of three things: first, great water; second, great fire; and third, warfare between the inhabitants and the outsiders.

source_sentence: 乃壞此城。」
translation: This city will then be destroyed.

source_sentence: 時，巴陵弗諸清信士通夜供辦，時到白佛：「食具已辦，唯聖知時。」
translation: When he arrived, he said to the Buddha, The food preparations have been prepared, but only the noble one knows the time.

source_sentence: 時，清信士即便施設，手自斟酌，食訖行水，別取小牀敷在佛前坐。
translation: The pure faithful monk then set up his own dishes, served them to the Buddha. After having eaten the food and drink, he took a small seat spread out in front of the Buddha’s presence and sat down.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即示之曰：「今汝此處賢智所居，多持戒者，淨修梵行，善神歡喜。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān showed him, Now, you're here in the abode of goodness and wisdom, where there are many who observe precepts and cultivate pure religious practices, and the good deities rejoice.

source_sentence: 即為呪願：「可敬知敬，可事知事，博施兼愛，有慈愍心，諸天所稱，
translation: He then wished for a spell, saying, You should be honored and respected, served and served, extensively given and loved, with kindness and compassion, praised by the gods.

source_sentence: 常與善俱，不與惡會。」
translation: They always associate with the good and don't associate with the bad.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊為說法已，即從座起，大眾圍遶，侍送而還。
translation: Having taught the Dharma for them, the World-honored One rose from his seat and, surrounded by the great assembly of bhikṣus, accompanied by their attendants, returned home.

source_sentence: 大臣禹舍從佛後行，時，作是念：「今沙門瞿曇出此城門，即名此門為瞿曇門。
translation: When the minister Upāsaka was walking behind the Buddha, he had this thought, Now, the ascetic Gautama leaves this gate of the city, which is called the Gautama Gate.

source_sentence: 又觀如來所渡河處，即名此處為瞿曇河。」
translation: Also, look at the place where the Tathāgata crosses the river, which is called this place as the Gautama River.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊出巴陵弗城，至于水邊，時，水岸上人民眾多，中有乘船渡者，
translation: At that time the World-honored One came out of the city of Pariputra and proceeded to the edge of the lake. There were many people on the water’s shore, some of whom boarded a ferryboat to cross the river.

source_sentence: 或有乘筏，或有乘桴而渡河者。
translation: Some ride on a raft, and some cross the river in a carriage.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊與諸大眾，譬如力士屈伸臂頃，忽至彼岸。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān and the assembled crowd were like a strong man who suddenly reached the other side in an instant's time as long as it took to bend and stretch out his arm.

source_sentence: 「佛為海船師，　　法橋渡河津；
translation: The Buddha is the captain of the navy, ferrying the Dharma bridge over the river.

source_sentence: 大乘道之輿，　　一切渡天人。
translation: The great vehicle of the Way, they all cross over to heaven and humans.

source_sentence: 亦為自解結，　　渡岸得昇仙；
translation: Also, in order to free themselves from bondage, They crossed the shore and attained enlightenment.

source_sentence: 都使諸弟子，　　縛解得涅槃。」
translation: They all cause their disciples to be bound and liberated and attain nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 世尊觀此義已，即說頌曰：爾時，世尊從跋祇遊行至拘利村，在一林下告諸比丘：「有四深法：一曰聖戒，
translation: At that time the World-honored One, going from Vṛji to the village of Kauṇḍinya, entered a forest and said to the bhikṣus: There are four profound dharmas. The first is morality.

source_sentence: 二曰聖定，三曰聖慧，四曰聖解脫。
translation: The second is noble concentration, the third noble wisdom, and the fourth noble liberation.

source_sentence: 此法微妙，難可解知，我及汝等，不曉了故，久在生死，流轉無窮。」
translation: This teaching is subtle and difficult to understand, and because I and you don't understand it, we've been in birth-and-death for a long time and have flowed without limit.

source_sentence: 「戒、定、慧解上，　　唯佛能分別；
translation: Only buddhas can distinguish the higher [levels of] morality, concentration, and wisdom.

source_sentence: 離苦而化彼，　　令斷生死習。」
translation: Being free of suffering, he transforms them so that they stop the habituation of birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊觀此義已，即說頌曰：爾時，世尊於拘利村隨宜住已、告阿難俱詣那陀村。
translation: After observing this meaning, the Bhagavān then spoke a verse, saying, At that point, the Bhagavān stayed as long as he wished in the village of Kauṇḍinya and told Ānanda to go to the village of Kālôdayin.

source_sentence: 阿難受教，即著衣持鉢，與大眾俱侍從世尊，路由跋祇，到那陀村，止揵椎處。
translation: Ānanda, having received the instruction, put on his robes, took his almsbowl, and, accompanied by the assembly of bhikṣus, followed the World-honored One. Traveling on the highway of Vṛji, he reached the village of Nāda and stopped at the place called Nirgrantha.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難在閑靜處，默自思惟：「此那陀村十二居士：一名伽伽羅，
translation: At that time, Ānanda was in a secluded place and quietly thought to himself:

source_sentence: 二名伽陵伽，三名毘伽陀，四名伽利輸，五名遮樓，六名婆耶樓，七名婆頭樓，
translation: The second name is Kaliṅga; the third name is Videha; the fourth name is Kālīśyapa; the fifth name is Cāripura; the sixth name is Bāyāpura; and the seventh name is Bhadrika.

source_sentence: 八名藪婆頭樓，九名陀梨舍[少\/兔]，十名藪達利舍[少\/兔]，十一名耶輸，
translation: The eighth name was Subhadra, the ninth Dhāriṣa[less\/rabbit], the tenth Sudarśa[less\/rabbit], and the eleventh Yaśodharā.

source_sentence: 十二名耶輸多樓。
translation: The twelveth name is Yaśodharā.

source_sentence: 此諸人等，今者命終，為生何處？
translation: Where will these people be born now, when their lives end?

source_sentence: 復有五十人命終，又復有五百人命終，斯生何處？」
translation: When another fifty people die and another five hundred die, where will they be born?

source_sentence: 作是念已，從靜處起至世尊所，頭面禮足，在一面坐，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After he had this thought, he rose from his seat in meditation and went to the Bhagavān, bowed his head at his feet, sat to one side, and said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我向靜處，默自思惟：『此那陀村十二居士伽伽羅等命終，復有五十人命終，
translation: Going toward the secluded place, I quietly thought to myself: These twelve householders of Nanda’s village died. There were fifty more who died,

source_sentence: 又有五百人命終，斯生何處？』
translation: Where will these five hundred people be born when their lives end?'

source_sentence: 唯願解說。」
translation: Please explain it.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「伽伽羅等十二人，斷五下分結，命終生天，於彼即般涅槃，
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda: Twelve such bhikṣus as the Kālā severed the five lower defilements and were reborn in heaven at the end of their life. At that place they entered nirvana.

source_sentence: 不復還此。
translation: I won't return here again.

source_sentence: 五十人命終者，斷除三結，婬、怒、癡薄，得斯陀含，還來此世，盡於苦本。
translation: When fifty people die, they'll be freed from the three bonds, weaken anger, anger, and delusion, attain once-returner status, return to this world, and end the source of suffering.

source_sentence: 五百人命終者，斷除三結，得須陀洹，不墮惡趣，必定成道，往來七生，
translation: When the five hundred people die, they are freed from the three fetters and attain stream-entry. They won’t fall into bad destinies, will surely achieve enlightenment, and will be reborn seven times in the future.

source_sentence: 盡於苦際。
translation: It ends at the point of suffering.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 夫生有死，自世之常，此何足恠？
translation: Birth and death are permanent in their own world, so what is the point of this?

source_sentence: 若一一人死，來問我者，非擾亂耶？」
translation: If one person dies and comes to ask me questions, isn't it a disturbance?

source_sentence: 阿難答曰：「信爾，世尊！
translation: Ānanda replied, Believe it, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 實是擾亂。」
translation: It's really a disturbance.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「今當為汝說於法鏡，使聖弟子知所生處。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, Now, I will explain the mirror of the Dharma for you, so that the noble disciple knows where he's born.

source_sentence: 三惡道盡，得須陀洹，不過七生，必盡苦際，亦能為他說如是事。
translation: When the three evil destinies are ended, they'll attain stream entry, and no more than seven lifetimes will pass, and they'll surely end the limit of suffering, and they'll be able to do so for others.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 法鏡者，謂聖弟子得不壞信，歡喜信佛、如來、無所著、等正覺，十號具足。
translation: The mirror of the Dharma means that the noble disciple attains indestructible faith and joyfully believes in the Buddha, the Tathāgata, Arhat, free from attachment, and Completely Awakened One, whose ten epithets are complete.

source_sentence: 歡喜信法：真正微妙，自恣所說，無有時節，示涅槃道，智者所行。
translation: They rejoice in faith in the Teaching: It is true and subtle, taught freely by themselves. There is no season for it; it shows the path leading to nirvana, which is practiced by wise people.

source_sentence: 歡喜信僧，善共和同，所行質直，無有諛諂，道果成就，上下和順，法身具足。
translation: They rejoice in faith in the Sangha and are well harmonious with each other. Their conduct is straightforward, without deceit or hypocrisy. They have attained the fruit of the path [of enlightenment] and are harmonious up and down; they are fully endowed with the Dharma body.

source_sentence: 向須陀洹、得須陀洹，向斯陀含、得斯陀含，向阿那含、得阿那含，向阿羅漢、得阿羅漢，
translation: He goes to stream-entry and attains stream-entry, he goes to once-returner and attains once-returner, he goes to non-returner and attains non-returner, he goes to arhat and attains arhat.

source_sentence: 四雙八輩，是謂如來賢聖之眾，甚可恭敬，世之福田。
translation: The four pairs and eight groups of people are called the Tathāgata’s wise and holy assembly. They should be greatly venerated as a field of blessedness for the world.

source_sentence: 信賢聖戒：清淨無穢，無有缺漏，明哲所行，獲三昧定。
translation: Faith in the virtuous and noble precepts: pure, undefiled, without deficiency or contamination, practiced by insight and wisdom, they attain samādhi concentration.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 是為法鏡，使聖弟子知所生處，三惡道盡，得須陀洹，不過七生，必盡苦際，
translation: This is the mirror of the Dharma that enables the noble disciple to know where he will be born. When the three evil destinies have ended and he attains stream-entry, he will surely end the state of suffering within seven lifetimes.

source_sentence: 亦能為他說如是事。」
translation: They can also do such things for others.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊隨宜住已，告阿難俱詣毘舍離國。
translation: After the Bhagavān had stayed there as appropriate, he told Ānanda to go to Vaiśālī together.

source_sentence: 即受教行，著衣持鉢，與大眾俱侍從世尊，路由跋祇，到毘舍離，坐一樹下。
translation: He then accepted the instruction, put on his robes, carried his bowl, and attended the Bhagavān with the rest of the assembly. On the way from Vṛji to Vaiśālī, he sat under a tree.

source_sentence: 有一婬女，名菴婆婆梨，聞佛將諸弟子來至毘舍離，坐一樹下，即嚴駕寶車，
translation: There was a promiscuous woman named Ambapālī who heard that the Buddha had come to Vaiśālī with his disciples and was seated under a tree.

source_sentence: 欲往詣佛所禮拜供養。
translation: They want to go to the Buddha's place to venerate and make offerings.

source_sentence: 未至之間，遙見世尊顏貌端正，諸根特異，相好備足，如星中月。
translation: Before he arrived, he saw from a distance that the Bhagavān's appearance was so graceful and his faculties were extraordinary, endowed with such good features like the moon among the stars.

source_sentence: 見已歡喜，下車步進，漸至佛所，頭面禮足，却坐一面。
translation: Rejoicing at that sight, he dismounted from his carriage and proceeded on foot. Having gradually reached the place where the Buddha was, he bowed his forehead at his feet and withdrew to sit off to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊漸為說法，示教利喜。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān gradually taught the Dharma for them, showing them how to benefit and delight in it.

source_sentence: 聞佛所說，發歡喜心，即白佛言：「從今日始，歸依三尊，唯願聽許於正法中為優婆夷，
translation: Having heard the Buddha’s exhortation, he was delighted and said to the Buddha: From today onward I take refuge in the Sangha of the Three Revered Ones. May your holiness permit me to become a lay follower of the true-dharma.

source_sentence: 盡此形壽，不殺、不盜、不邪婬、不妄語、不飲酒。」
translation: For the rest of their physical life, they won't kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, speak falsehoods, and drink alcohol.

source_sentence: 又白佛言：「唯願世尊及諸弟子明受我請，即於今暮止宿我園。」
translation: Again, he said to the Buddha, Please let the Bhagavān and his disciples clearly accept my invitation, so that they'll stay overnight in my park at sunset this evening.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊默然受之。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān accepted it in silence.

source_sentence: 女見佛默然許可，即從座起，頭面禮足，遶佛而歸。
translation: Seeing the Buddha's silent approval, the woman rose from her seat, bowed her head and feet, circumambulated him, and returned.

source_sentence: 其去未久，佛告阿難：「當與汝等詣彼園觀。」
translation: Not long after he left, the Buddha told Ānanda, I'll go with you to that park and observe it.

source_sentence: 對曰：「唯然。」
translation: He replied, Yes.

source_sentence: 佛即從座起，攝持衣鉢，與眾弟子千二百五十人俱詣彼園。
translation: The Buddha then rose from his seat, gathered his robes and bowl, and accompanied by one thousand two hundred and fifty disciples, went to that park.

source_sentence: 時，毘舍離諸隷車輩，聞佛在菴婆婆梨園中止住，即便嚴駕五色寶車，
translation: When the Licchavi clanspeople of Vaiśālī heard that the Buddha was staying at Ambapālī’s Park, they immediately prepared a carriage drawn by five-colored jeweled carts.

source_sentence: 或乘青車青馬，衣、蓋、幢幡、官屬皆青，五色車馬，皆亦如是。
translation: Or they may ride a blue chariot or a blue horse with blue robes, canopies, banners, streamers, and officials all blue, and so it is with the five-colored chariots and horses.

source_sentence: 時，五百隷車服色盡同，欲往詣佛，菴婆婆梨辭佛還家，中路逢諸隷車。
translation: When the five hundred Licchavi clanspeople, all dressed in the same colors as the Buddha, wished to visit him, Ambapālī withdrew from the Buddha’s presence and returned home.

source_sentence: 時，車行[馬*奔]疾，與彼寶車共相鈎撥，損折幢蓋而不避道，隷車責曰：「汝恃何勢，
translation: At that moment, the chariot was traveling [on horseback] with an ailment. It hooked up with the other treasured chariot and broke the canopy of the banner but did not avoid the road. The Licchavi Vimalakīrti said in reply, “What power are you relying on?

source_sentence: 行不避道，衝撥我車，損折麾葢？」
translation: If you don't run away from the path, why would you attack my chariot and damage the garrison?

source_sentence: 報曰：「諸貴！

source_sentence: 我已請佛明日設食，歸家供辦，是以行速，無容相避。」
translation: I've already invited the Buddha to set up a meal tomorrow and returned home to make offerings, so I'll go quickly; there's no room for them to avoid each other.

source_sentence: 諸隷車即語女曰：「且置汝請，當先與我，我當與汝百千兩金？」
translation: The Licchavi said to the woman, Let's leave it up to you to ask, and you must first give me a hundred thousand taels of gold.

source_sentence: 女尋答曰：「先請已定，不得相與。」
translation: The woman replied, I've already invited you, but I won't give it to you.

source_sentence: 時，諸隷車又語女曰：「我更與汝十六倍百千兩金，必使我先？」
translation: The Licchavi again said to the woman, I'll give you another sixteen times a hundred thousand taels of gold, and will surely make me first?

source_sentence: 女猶不肯：「我請已定，不可爾也。」
translation: The woman still didn't agree, saying, I've invited you to do so; it won't be allowed.

source_sentence: 時，諸隷車又語女曰：「我今與爾中分國財，可先與我？」
translation: The Licchavi then again said to the woman, Now that I've given you half of your national wealth, can you give it to me first?

source_sentence: 女又報曰：「設使舉國財寶，我猶不取；
translation: The woman also replied, “Suppose I were to offer you the riches and treasures of my country.

source_sentence: 所以然者，佛住我園，先受我請，此事已了，終不相與。」
translation: That's why the Buddha stayed in my garden and first accepted my invitation, and after this matter was settled, they never gave it to each other.

source_sentence: 諸隷車等各振手歎咤：「今由斯女闕我初福。」
translation: The Licchavi and others each raised their hands and praised him, Now, it's because this woman lacks my first blessing.

source_sentence: 即便前進徑詣彼園。
translation: He then went on his way to the other park.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊遙見五百隷車，車馬數萬，填道而來，告諸比丘：「汝等欲知忉利諸天遊戲園觀，
translation: At that time the World-honored One saw from a distance five hundred Licchavi clanspeople, accompanied by tens of thousands of chariots and horses, coming along the highway. He said to the bhikṣus:

source_sentence: 威儀容飾，與此無異。
translation: Their manner and appearance are no different from those of the monastery.

source_sentence: 汝等比丘！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 當自攝心，具諸威儀。
translation: You should control your mind and be endowed with proper manners.

source_sentence: 云何比丘自攝其心？
translation: How does a monk control his own mind?

source_sentence: 於是比丘內身身觀，精勤不懈，憶念不忘，捨世貪憂；
translation: The bhikṣu thus observed his inner body and mind without slackening, exerting himself with diligence or laxity. Being mindful of his observations, he kept them in memory and relinquished worldly desires and cravings.

source_sentence: 外身身觀，精勤不懈，憶念不忘，捨世貪憂；
translation: He observed the outer body as body, exerting himself with no slackening, being mindful and keeping it in memory; he relinquished worldly desires and cravings.

source_sentence: 內外身觀，精勤不懈，捨世貪憂。
translation: He observes the body internally and externally, exerting himself without slackening, abandoning worldly desires and cravings.

source_sentence: 受、意、法觀，亦復如是。
translation: So it is with the contemplation of feeling, mind, and dharmas.

source_sentence: 云何比丘具諸威儀？
translation: How is a monk endowed with all manner of deportment?

source_sentence: 於是比丘可行知行，可止知止，左右顧視，屈伸俯仰，攝持衣鉢，食飲湯藥，
translation: Thereupon, the bhikṣu may walk as he pleases and knows how to walk. He should restrain himself and know how to restrain himself. With his left and right facing each other, [the bhikṣu] bends, stretches, bows, stoops, and looks upward in both directions. He keeps his clothes, bowl, food, water, and medicine

source_sentence: 不失宜則，善設方便，除去蔭蓋，行住坐臥，覺寤語默，攝心不亂，是謂比丘具諸威儀。」
translation: Not losing the appropriate rules and skillfully setting them up, removing the canopy of shade, walking, standing, sitting, and lying down, feeling compassion, speaking quietly, collecting his mind without disturbance, this is called a monk with proper manners.

source_sentence: 爾時，五百隷車往至菴婆婆梨園，欲到佛所，下車步進，頭面禮足，却坐一面。
translation: At that time the five hundred Licchavi clanspeople approached Ambapālī’s grove. Wishing to visit the Buddha, they dismounted from their carriages and proceeded on foot. After honoring him by bowing their foreheads at his feet, they withdrew and sat off to one side.

source_sentence: 如來在座，光相獨顯，蔽諸大眾，譬如秋月，又如天地清明，淨無塵翳，
translation: When the Tathāgata was seated, his ray of light illuminated the entire assembly like an autumn moon. Like heaven and earth shining brightly without dust or dirt, pure and spotless, he illumined the whole assembly.

source_sentence: 日在虛空，光明獨照。
translation: The sun is shining in the sky, but its light shines alone.

source_sentence: 爾時，五百隷車圍遶侍坐，佛於眾中，光相獨明。
translation: At that time the Buddha was seated, surrounded by five hundred Licchavi clanspeople. Among the members of the assembly, the Buddha alone illuminated them with his shining form.

source_sentence: 是時，坐中有一梵志名曰并餼，即從座起，偏袒右臂，右膝著地，叉手向佛，
translation: At that time, there was a brāhmaṇa in his seat called Upagupta. He rose from his seat, arranged his right shoulder, knelt with his right knee on the ground, saluted the Buddha by placing his palms together [in respect].

source_sentence: 「摩竭鴦伽王，　　為快得善利，
translation: “King Magadha Aṅga, wishing to quickly attain good fortune,

source_sentence: 身被寶珠鎧，　　世尊出其土。
translation: His body was covered with a jeweled armor, and the Bhagavān emerged from that land.

source_sentence: 威德動三千，　　名顯如雪山，
translation: Their might and virtue move the three thousand, And their fame is as great as that of the Himalayas.

source_sentence: 如蓮花開敷，　　香氣甚微妙。
translation: It's like a lotus flower blooming and its fragrance is so subtle.

source_sentence: 今覩佛光明，　　如日之初出，
translation: Now the brightness of the Buddha’s ray of light Is like the first ray of the sun.

source_sentence: 如月遊虛空，　　無有諸雲翳。
translation: It's like the moon traveling through space, with no clouds covering it.

source_sentence: 世尊亦如是，　　光照於世間，
translation: The World-Honored One is also like this: his light illumines the world.

source_sentence: 觀如來智慧，　　猶闇覩錠鐐，
translation: Observing the wisdom of the Enlightened One is like a dark night in a cave.

source_sentence: 施眾以明眼，　　決了諸疑惑。」
translation: Giving to the crowd with the eye of insight, he resolves doubts and doubts.

source_sentence: 以偈讚曰：時，五百隷車聞此偈已，復告并餼：「汝可重說。」
translation: He praised them in verse, saying, When the five hundred Licchavis heard this verse, they again told Upagupta, You may explain it again.

source_sentence: 爾時，并餼即於佛前再三重說。
translation: At that point, it was explained repeatedly and repeatedly before the Buddha.

source_sentence: 時，五百隷車聞重說偈已，各脫寶衣，以施并餼，并餼即以寶衣奉上如來，
translation: When the five hundred Licchavi clanspeople had heard these verses recited, they each took off their precious robes and offered them to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 佛愍彼故，即為納受。
translation: Because the Buddha pitied them, he accepted it for their sake.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告毘舍離諸隷車曰：「世有五寶甚為難得。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the Licchavi ministers of Vaiśālī, saying, There are five treasures in the world that are very difficult to attain.

source_sentence: 何等為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者如來、至真出現於世，甚為難得。
translation: One, it's very difficult for the Tathāgata and the supreme truth to appear in the world.

source_sentence: 二者如來正法能演說者，此人難得。
translation: Second, it is difficult to find someone who teaches the true teaching of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 三者如來演法能信解者，此人難得。
translation: Third, the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma to those who can believe and understand it, but these people are difficult to find.

source_sentence: 四者如來演法能成就者，此人難得。
translation: 4. It's difficult for someone like the Tathāgata who teaches the Dharma and can accomplish it.

source_sentence: 五者嶮危救厄知反復者，此人難得。
translation: Five, it's difficult to save those who are in danger and know that they're going back and forth.

source_sentence: 是謂五寶為難得也。」
translation: This means that the five treasures are difficult to attain.

source_sentence: 時，五百隷車聞佛示教利喜已，即白佛言：「唯願世尊及諸弟子明受我請！」
translation: After hearing the Buddha's instructions and benefits, the five hundred Licchavi clanspeople then said to the Buddha, Please let the Bhagavān and his disciples clearly accept my invitation!

source_sentence: 佛告隷車：「卿已請我，我今便為得供養已，菴婆婆梨女先已請訖。」
translation: The Buddha told Licchavi, You've invited me, and now that I've received an offering, the woman Ambapālī has already invited me.

source_sentence: 時，五百隷車聞菴婆婆梨女已先請佛，各振手而言：「吾欲供養如來，
translation: When the five hundred Licchavi clanspeople heard that Ambapālī had first invited the Buddha, they each raised their hands and said, “I wish to honor the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 而今此女已奪我先。」
translation: Now, this woman has taken it from me.

source_sentence: 即從座起，頭面禮佛，遶佛三匝，各自還歸。
translation: They rose from their seats, bowed their foreheads and faces to the Buddha, circumambulated him three times, and each returned.

source_sentence: 時，菴婆婆梨女即於其夜種種供辦，明日時到，世尊即與千二百五十比丘整衣持鉢，
translation: That night Ambapālī prepared various foods for the feast. On the following day, when the time came, the World-honored One gave them to one thousand two hundred and fifty bhikṣus, dressed in proper clothing and with almsbowl in hand, an almsbowl [for the Buddha’s sake]:

source_sentence: 前後圍遶，詣彼請所，就座而坐。
translation: Surrounded by them in front and behind him, he went to the place where they were invited, took his seat, and sat down.

source_sentence: 時，菴婆婆梨女即設上饌，供佛及僧。
translation: The woman Ambapālī then prepared a delicious dish to offer to the Buddha and the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 食訖去鉢，并除机案。
translation: After he had eaten, he removed his bowl and took off his desk.

source_sentence: 時，女手執金瓶，行澡水畢，前白佛言：「此毘耶離城所有園觀，我園最勝，
translation: The woman then took the golden pitcher in her hand and, after having bathed herself with water, said to the Buddha: Among all the pleasure parks and pavilions of Vaiśālī, this one is the best.

source_sentence: 今以此園貢上如來，哀愍我故，願垂納受。」
translation: Now, this is a tribute to the Tathāgata who has pity for my sake in this garden and wishes to accept it.

source_sentence: 佛告女曰：「汝可以此園施佛為首及招提僧。
translation: The Buddha told the woman, You may give this park to the Buddha as your head and the Zhaoti saṃgha.

source_sentence: 所以然者？
translation: Why is this so?

source_sentence: 如來所有園林、房舍、衣鉢六物，正使諸魔、釋、梵、大神力天，無有能堪受此供者。」
translation: The six things that the Tathāgata possesses are gardens, forests, dwellings, clothing, bowls, and robes, just so no Māra, Śākyamuni, Brahmā, or Mahāprajñāpāramitā gods will be able to accept this offering.

source_sentence: 時，女受教，即以此園施佛為首及招提僧。
translation: The woman then accepted the teaching and gave this park to the Buddha as the head of the offering and the saṃgha in Zhaoti.

source_sentence: 「起塔立精舍，　　園果施清涼；
translation: He built a stūpa, erected a monastery, And offered fruit and gardens for coolness.

source_sentence: 橋船以渡人，　　曠野施水草。
translation: Bridges and boats are used to ferry people, and water and grass are given in the wilderness.

source_sentence: 及以堂閣施，　　其福日夜增；
translation: And giving with a hall and a pavilion, Their merit increases day and night.

source_sentence: 戒具清淨者，　　彼必到善方。」
translation: If the precepts are complete and pure, they'll surely go to a good place.

source_sentence: 佛愍彼故，即為受之，而說偈言：時，菴婆婆梨女取一小牀於佛前坐，
translation: At that moment, Ambapālī took a small couch and sat before the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛漸為說法，示教利喜：施論、戒論、生天之論，欲為大患，穢汙不淨，
translation: The Buddha gradually taught them the Dharma, encouraging, guiding, benefiting, and delighting them: “The doctrine of generosity, the doctrine of morality, the doctrine of rebirth in heaven, and the doctrine that desire is a great danger and filthy and impure evil.

translation: At that time, the World-honored One knew that Ambapālī’s mind was gentle and peaceful. Their shade and comfort were slight and they could easily be educated. In accordance with the teaching of the buddhas, he taught her the holy truth of suffering.

source_sentence: 苦集、苦滅、苦出要諦。
translation: They are the essential truths of suffering's accumulation, suffering's cessation, and suffering's escape.

source_sentence: 時，菴婆婆梨女信心清淨，譬如淨潔白氈易為受色，即於座上遠塵離垢，
translation: The Ambapālī’s faith was pure and genuine, like white cloth that can easily be dyed any color.

source_sentence: 諸法法眼生，見法得法，決定正住，不墮惡道，成就無畏，而白佛言：「我今歸依佛，
translation: When the Dharma eye of all dharmas arises, he sees the Dharma and attains the Dharma. He is certain to abide correctly, not falling into evil paths, and has perfected fearlessness. Then he said to the Buddha:

source_sentence: 歸依法，歸依僧。」
translation: They take refuge in the Dharma and rely on the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 如是再三。
translation: He repeated it three times like this.

source_sentence: 「唯願如來聽我於正法中為優婆夷！
translation: May the Tathāgata hear me become a layman in the right teaching!

source_sentence: 自今已後，盡壽不殺、不盜、不邪婬、不欺、不飲酒。」
translation: From now until the end of my life, I won't kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, lie, or drink alcohol.

source_sentence: 時，彼女從佛受五戒已，捨本所習，穢垢消除，即從座起，禮佛而去。
translation: The woman then received the five precepts from the Buddha, abandoned what she had practiced in the past, removed all defilement, rose from her seat, venerated the Buddha, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於毘舍離，隨宜住已，告阿難言：「汝等皆嚴，吾欲詣竹林叢。」
translation: After the Bhagavān had stayed at Vaiśālī as appropriate, he told Ānanda, All of you are so strict that I want to go to the bamboo grove.

source_sentence: 對曰：「唯然。」
translation: He replied, Yes.

source_sentence: 即嚴衣鉢，與大眾侍從世尊，路由跋祇，至彼竹林。
translation: He prepared his robes and bowl, accompanied by the World-honored One, and proceeded on the highway of Vṛji to that bamboo grove.

translation: There was a certain brāhmaṇa called Vaiśravaṇa. Hearing that the Buddha and his disciples were coming to this bamboo grove, he remained silent and thought:

source_sentence: 名德流布，聞於四方，十號具足，於諸天、釋、梵、魔、若魔、天、沙門、婆羅門中，
translation: His name and virtue spread in the four directions, being heard everywhere. He is endowed with the ten supreme titles among all the gods, among the Sakyans, among the Brahmās, among the Māras, among the deities, among the ascetics, among the śramaṇas, among the brāhmaṇas,

source_sentence: 自身作證，為他說法，上中下言，皆悉真正，義味深奧，梵行具足。
translation: He himself realizes it and teaches the Dharma for others. The above, middle, and following sayings are all genuine, profound in meaning and flavor, endowed with the practice of austerity.

source_sentence: 如此真人，宜往瞻覩。」
translation: It's better to go and see such a great person.

source_sentence: 時，婆羅門出於竹叢，往詣世尊，問訊訖，一面坐，世尊漸為說法，示教利喜。
translation: The brāhmaṇa came out of the bamboo grove and approached the World-honored One. After greeting him with a bow, he took his seat at one side. The World-honored One gradually taught the Dharma to him, encouraging, benefiting, and delighting him.

source_sentence: 婆羅門聞已歡喜，即請世尊及諸大眾明日舍食。
translation: Having heard this, the brāhmaṇa was delighted and immediately invited the World-honored One as well as the members of the sangha to the monastery for tomorrow’s meal.

source_sentence: 時，佛默然受請。
translation: The Buddha then remained silent and accepted the invitation.

source_sentence: 婆羅門知已許可，即從座起，遶佛而歸。
translation: Knowing that he had given his permission, the brāhmaṇa rose from his seat, circumambulated the Buddha, and departed.

source_sentence: 即於其夜，供設飲食。
translation: On that night, he offered food and drink.

source_sentence: 明日時到，唯聖知時。
translation: When the time came on the morning, only the emperor knew the time.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊著衣持鉢，大眾圍遶往詣彼舍，就座而坐。
translation: At that time the World-honored One, putting on his outer robe and with his almsbowl in hand, surrounded by the assembly of bhikṣus, approached the monastery. He took his seat [right there].

source_sentence: 時，婆羅門設種種甘饌，供佛及僧。
translation: The brāhmaṇa offered various delicious foods to the Buddha and the members of the sangha.

source_sentence: 食訖去鉢，行澡水畢，取一小牀於佛前坐。
translation: After he had finished eating, he left his bowl and went to bathe in water. He took a small couch and sat before the Buddha.

source_sentence: 「若以飲食，　　衣服臥具，

source_sentence: 施持戒人，　　則獲大果。
translation: Giving to someone who upholds the precepts will bring great reward.

source_sentence: 此為真伴，　　終始相隨，
translation: These are their true companions, following each other from beginning to end.

source_sentence: 所至到處，　　如影隨形。
translation: Wherever he goes, it's like a shadow following its form.

source_sentence: 是故種善，　　為後世粮，
translation: That is why they sow the seeds of goodness for the sake of future generations.

source_sentence: 福為根基，　　眾生以安。
translation: Merit is the foundation of roots, and sentient beings are the basis of peace.

source_sentence: 福為天護，　　行不危嶮，
translation: Blessedness is the guardian of gods, Who are not afraid of danger when traveling.

source_sentence: 生不遭難，　　死則上天。」
translation: Birth isn't difficult, and death goes up to heaven.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊為婆羅門而作頌曰：爾時，世尊為婆羅門說微妙法，示教利喜已，
translation: At that time, the World-honored One spoke these verses to the brāhmaṇa:

source_sentence: 從座而去。
translation: He left his seat and departed.

translation: At the time, that land and grain were so valuable and hungry that it was difficult to obtain what they wanted, and the Buddha told Ānanda, I've ordered all the monks in this country to assemble in the lecture hall.

source_sentence: 對曰：「唯然。」
translation: He replied, Yes.

source_sentence: 即承教旨，宣令遠近普集講堂。
translation: He then inherited the teaching and ordered people from near and far to assemble at the assembly hall.

source_sentence: 是時，國內大眾皆集，阿難白佛言：「大眾已集，唯聖知時。」
translation: At the time, all the masses in the country gathered together, and Ānanda said to the Buddha, The masses have assembled, but only the noble one knows the time.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即從座起，詣於講堂，就座而坐，告諸比丘：「此土飢饉，
translation: At that time, the World-honored One rose from his seat. Having arrived at the assembly hall, he took his seat in the prepared position and said to the monks:

source_sentence: 乞求難得，汝等宜各分部，隨所知識，詣毘舍離及越祇國，於彼安居，
translation: It is difficult to obtain almsfood. All of you, please be divided into groups and go to Vaiśālī or Vṛji country wherever you are able to make yourselves acquainted.

translation: It can be without deficiency.
